param.help: This is a value that will be prefixed to output file names

Step increase values to be iterated

param.name: input_values
param.label: User input values
param.help: List of all comma separated values for the parameter

param.name: step
param.label: Step
param.help: Increment to use from first to last value

param.name: end_value
param.label: Ending value
param.help: Final value for the parameter. The final value is not included if increments of step don't match the last value.

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**What it does**
Given start, step and end, it will iterate parameters for either perplexity (for t-SNE), resolution (clustering) or number of neighbours (neighbour graph construction).
**Inputs**
* Parameter name: either Resolution or Perplexity. * Starting value: float for Resolution, integer for Perplexity. * Step: float for Resolution, integer for Perplexity. * End value: float for Resolution, integer for Perplexity.
**Outputs**
* Collection of parameters to be passed to either Scanpy run tSNE (perplexity) or Scanpy find clusters (resolution).
